Question:
Read the given passage and answer the questions that follow.
We sit in the last row, bumped about but free of stares. The bus rolls out of the dull crossroads of the city, and we are soon in the open countryside, with fields of sunflowers as far as the eye can see, their heads all facing us. Where there is no water, the land reverts to the desert. While still on level ground, we see in the distance the tall range of the Mount Bogda, abrupt like a shining prism laid horizontally on the desert surface. It is over 5,000 metres high, and the peaks are under permanent snow, in powerful contrast to the flat desert all around. Heaven lake lies part of the way up this range, about 2,000 metres above sea level, at the foot of one of the highest snow-peaks.
As the bus climbs, the sky, brilliant before, grows overcast. I have brought nothing warm to wear. It is all down at the hotel in Urumqi. Rain begins to fall. The man behind me is eating overpoweringly smelly goat’s cheese. The bus window leaks inhospitably but reveals a beautiful view. We have passed quickly from the desert through arable land to pasture and the ground is now green with grass, the slopes dark with pine. A few cattle drink at a clear stream flowing past moss-covered stones; it is a Constable landscape. The stream changes into a white torrent, and as we climb higher I wish more and more that I had brought with me something warmer than the pair of shorts that have served me so well in the desert. The stream (which, we are told, rises in Heaven Lake) disappears, and we continue our slow ascent. About noon, we arrive at Heaven Lake, and look for a place to stay at the foot, which is the resort area. We get a room in a small cottage, and I am happy to note that there are thick quilts on the bed.
Standing outside the cottage, we survey our surroundings. Heaven Lake is long, sardine-shaped and fed by snowmelt from a stream at its head. The lake is an intense blue, surrounded on all sides by green mountain walls, dotted with distant sheep. At the head of the lake, beyond the delta of the inflowing stream, is a massive snow-capped peak which dominates the vista; it is part of a series of peaks that culminate, a little out of view, in Mount Bogda itself.
For those who live in the resort, there is a small mess-hall by the shore. We eat here sometimes, and sometimes buy food from the vendors outside, who sell kabab and naan until the last buses leave. The kababs, cooked on skewers over charcoal braziers, are particularly good; highly spiced and well-done. Horse’s milk is available too from the local Kazakh herdsmen, but I decline this. I am so affected by the cold that Mr. Cao, the relaxed young man who runs the mess, lends me a spare pair of trousers, several sizes too large but more than comfortable. Once I am warm again, I feel a pre-dinner spurt of energy—dinner will be long in coming—and I ask him whether the lake is good for swimming in

Question:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the word ‘accept’ from the passage
Solution:
Here the correct answer is Decline.
Key Points
  • The word "accept" means to receive willingly or to agree to something.
    • Example: She accepted the job offer without hesitation.
  • The correct answer is "decline" because it is used in the passage as an antonym for "accept."
  • In the context of the passage, "decline" means to politely turn down an offer or suggestion.
    • Example: I had to decline the invitation to the party because I had already made plans for that night.​
  • Example of "decline" being used in this sense in the passage include:
    • "Horse’s milk is available too from the local Kazakh herdsmen, but I decline this," and "I wish more and more that I had brought with me something warmer than the pair of shorts that have served me so well in the desert."
  • Thus, the correct answer is Option 3.
Additional Information
  • Option 1, "reject," is also an antonym of "accept" but it is not present in the passage. It means to refuse something in a more forceful or harsh way.
  • An example of "reject" being used in this sense might be: "I rejected the offer to join the club because I didn't like their policies."
  • Option 2, "refuse," is an antonym of "accept" but it is not present in the passage. It means to turn down an offer or request.
  • An example of "refuse" being used in this sense might be: "I refused the extra slice of cake because I was already full."
  • Option 4, "turn down," is also an antonym of "accept" but it is not present in the passage. It means to refuse an offer or invitation.
  • An example of "turn down" being used in this sense might be: "I had to turn down the job offer because I had already accepted a different job."

  • The other options, "Shorts to Trousers," "Peasant Life," and "Journey to Mount Bogda," do not accurately capture the main focus of the passage, which is the author's observations and experiences at Heaven Lake.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is option 2) "Lake Heaven."

Question:
Read the given passage and answer the questions that follow.
We sit in the last row, bumped about but free of stares. The bus rolls out of the dull crossroads of the city, and we are soon in the open countryside, with fields of sunflowers as far as the eye can see, their heads all facing us. Where there is no water, the land reverts to the desert. While still on level ground, we see in the distance the tall range of the Mount Bogda, abrupt like a shining prism laid horizontally on the desert surface. It is over 5,000 metres high, and the peaks are under permanent snow, in powerful contrast to the flat desert all around. Heaven lake lies part of the way up this range, about 2,000 metres above sea level, at the foot of one of the highest snow-peaks.
As the bus climbs, the sky, brilliant before, grows overcast. I have brought nothing warm to wear. It is all down at the hotel in Urumqi. Rain begins to fall. The man behind me is eating overpoweringly smelly goat’s cheese. The bus window leaks inhospitably but reveals a beautiful view. We have passed quickly from the desert through arable land to pasture and the ground is now green with grass, the slopes dark with pine. A few cattle drink at a clear stream flowing past moss-covered stones; it is a Constable landscape. The stream changes into a white torrent, and as we climb higher I wish more and more that I had brought with me something warmer than the pair of shorts that have served me so well in the desert. The stream (which, we are told, rises in Heaven Lake) disappears, and we continue our slow ascent. About noon, we arrive at Heaven Lake, and look for a place to stay at the foot, which is the resort area. We get a room in a small cottage, and I am happy to note that there are thick quilts on the bed.
Standing outside the cottage, we survey our surroundings. Heaven Lake is long, sardine-shaped and fed by snowmelt from a stream at its head. The lake is an intense blue, surrounded on all sides by green mountain walls, dotted with distant sheep. At the head of the lake, beyond the delta of the inflowing stream, is a massive snow-capped peak which dominates the vista; it is part of a series of peaks that culminate, a little out of view, in Mount Bogda itself.
For those who live in the resort, there is a small mess-hall by the shore. We eat here sometimes, and sometimes buy food from the vendors outside, who sell kabab and naan until the last buses leave. The kababs, cooked on skewers over charcoal braziers, are particularly good; highly spiced and well-done. Horse’s milk is available too from the local Kazakh herdsmen, but I decline this. I am so affected by the cold that Mr. Cao, the relaxed young man who runs the mess, lends me a spare pair of trousers, several sizes too large but more than comfortable. Once I am warm again, I feel a pre-dinner spurt of energy—dinner will be long in coming—and I ask him whether the lake is good for swimming in

Question:
What is the tone of the passage?
Solution:
Here the correct answer is Serene.
Key Points
  • The tone of the passage is serene.
  • The passage describes the journey of the author on a bus through the countryside and up to Heaven Lake, where they stay for a while.
  • The descriptions of the scenery, the lake, and the food are all presented in a calm and peaceful way, with no indication of anger or agitation.
  • The author's thoughts and actions are also calm and measured, such as when they note the lack of warm clothing but do not panic, and when they decline the offer of horse's milk without fuss.
  • Option 1) Romantic: This option is not correct because the passage does not contain any romantic elements or emotions. Although the author appreciates the beauty of the scenery, the descriptions are not written in a romantic or emotional way.
  • Option 2) Angry: This option is not correct because there is no indication of anger or frustration in the passage. The author's tone is consistently calm and serene.
  • Option 4) Agitated: This option is not correct because the passage does not contain any indication of agitation or anxiety. The author is calm and observant throughout the journey, even when faced with uncomfortable situations like the cold weather and smelly cheese.

Question:
Read the following passage and answer the questions given after it.
From January 28 to February 4, 2023, a Chinese-operated, large white high-altitude balloon was seen in North American airspace, including Alaska, western Canada, and the contiguous United States. The American and Canadian militaries asserted that the balloon was for surveillance, while the Chinese government maintained it was a civilian meteorological research airship that had been blown off course. Analysts said that the balloon's flight path and structural characteristics made it dissimilar from those which have typically been used for meteorological research. The U.S. Department of State said that the balloon was capable of locating electronic communication devices, including mobile phones and radios, and that American U-2 reconnaissance aircraft deployed to track the balloon in the air revealed that the balloon carried antennas and other equipment "clearly for intelligence surveillance and inconsistent with the equipment on board weather balloons." The State Department said that the spy balloon was part of a global Chinese military-directed surveillance effort in which Chinese spy balloons have flown over more than 40 nations in five continents. On February 4, the U.S. Air Force shot down the balloon over U.S. territorial waters off the coast of South Carolina, on the order of U.S. President Joe Biden. Debris from the wreckage was recovered and sent to the FBI Laboratory in Quantico, Virginia, for analysis. The incident increased U.S.-China tensions. The incident prompted U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken to delay a diplomatic visit to Beijing, which was set to be his first since 2018. It also further strained Canada–China relations, as Canada summoned the Chinese ambassador because of the violation of Canadian airspace. On February 3, the U.S. Department of Defense announced that a second Chinese balloon was passing over Latin America, which China also said belonged to it. On February 10, the Air Force shot down another aerial object over U.S. territory at the order of President Biden.

Question:
The passage is mainly about
OP1: the strained relations between US and China
OP2: a Chinese spy balloon flying over US and Canadian territories
OP4: Chinese balloons flying all over the world
Solution:
The correct answer is 2) a Chinese spy balloon flying over US and Canadian territories.
Key Points
  • The passage describes a specific incident in which a Chinese-operated balloon was seen in North American airspace and was believed to be conducting surveillance.
  • The American and Canadian militaries assert that the balloon was for surveillance, while the Chinese government maintained it was a civilian meteorological research airship that had been blown off course.
  • The passage provides details about the balloon's flight path, structural characteristics, and equipment, as well as the U.S. government's response to the incident, which included shooting down the balloon and delaying a diplomatic visit to China.
  • The other options are too broad or too specific to accurately reflect the main focus of the passage.
  • Thus, the correct answer is Option 2.

Question:
Read the statements given below.
A. The US Air Force shot down the Chinese balloon over US territorial waters.
B. Tensions between China and US have increased and the visit of the U.S. Secretary of State to Beijing has been postponed.
OP1: Both A and B are true but B is not the correct reason for A.
OP2: Both A and B are true and A is the correct reason for B.
OP3: A is false and B is true.
OP4: A is true and B is false.
Solution:
The correct answer is option 2: Both A and B are true and A is the correct reason for B.
Key Points
  • According to the passage, the US Air Force did indeed shoot down the Chinese balloon over US territorial waters on February 4, 2023, as ordered by US President Joe Biden. This confirms statement A as true.
  • The passage also states that the incident increased tensions between China and the US, as well as strained Canada-China relations, and prompted US Secretary of State Antony Blinken to delay a diplomatic visit to Beijing.
  • This confirms statement B as true.
  • Additionally, it can be inferred from the passage that the increased tensions between China and the US were at least partially due to the incident with the spy balloon, making statement A the correct reason for statement B.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is option 2.

Question:
How did US make sure that the Balloon flying over its territory was a ‘spy’ balloon?
OP1: the FBI lab confirmed that it was a spy balloon
OP2: the analysts studied its flight path and said so
OP3: it’s reconnaissance aircraft saw the antennas and equipment of the balloon
OP4: it got the samples of the balloon checked in a lab
Solution:
Here the correct answer is "It’s reconnaissance aircraft saw the antennas and equipment of the balloon".
Key Points
  • The correct answer is option 3: its reconnaissance aircraft saw the antennas and equipment of the balloon.
  • This is because the U.S. Department of State said that American U-2 reconnaissance aircraft deployed to track the balloon in the air revealed that the balloon carried antennas and other equipment "clearly for intelligence surveillance and inconsistent with the equipment on board weather balloons."
  • Therefore, it was the reconnaissance aircraft that provided the evidence to the U.S. government that the balloon was a spy balloon.
  • Thus, the correct answer is Option 3.
Additional Information
  • Option 1 is incorrect because while debris from the wreckage was sent to the FBI Laboratory for analysis, there is no information provided in the passage that suggests the FBI confirmed that it was a spy balloon.
  • Option 2 is also incorrect because while analysts said that the balloon's flight path and structural characteristics made it dissimilar from those typically used for meteorological research, this is not enough evidence to definitively label it a spy balloon.
  • Option 4 is incorrect because the passage does not mention any samples being taken from the balloon for testing.

Question:
The word ‘contiguous’ means
Solution:
Here the correct answer is Adjoining.
Key Points
  • The word contiguous is an adjective that describes things that are touching along a boundary or sharing a common border.
  • In the context of the passage, it refers to the United States being adjacent to Canada, meaning that they share a border.
  • Examples:
    • The two houses had contiguous backyards, so the children could easily play together.
    • The contiguous states of the United States are all connected, meaning that you can travel by land from one state to another without having to cross a border.
  • Adjoining means next to or touching something else.
    • For example, two houses that share a common wall are said to be adjoining houses. Similarly, adjoining rooms in a hotel or a building are located next to each other.
  • Thus, the correct answer is Option 1.
Additional Information
  • The other options are:
  • far off: This means something that is at a considerable distance away.
    • Example: The island was far off in the distance, barely visible on the horizon.
  • spreading: This means something that is expanding or growing larger.
    • Example: The wildfire was spreading quickly, and firefighters were struggling to contain it.
  • separated: This means something that is isolated or kept apart from other things.
    • Example: The two groups were separated by a large fence, so they could not interact with each other.

Question: Who composed Tabaqat-i-Nasiri in the Delhi Sultanate period?
Solution:
The correct answer is Minhaj-us-Siraj.
Key Points
  • The book "Tabaqat-i-Nasiri" is written by "Minhaj-us-Siraj".
  • It is an elaborate history of the Islamic world written in Persian.
  • It was completed in 1260.
  • Its purpose was to account for the Muslim dynasties that originated in Iran and Central Asia.
  • It is the only source for the Khalijis rebellion in Bengal against the sultan of Delhi from 1229-1230.
  • It consists of 23 volumes and written in a blunt straightforward style.
Additional Information
Ziauddin Barani:
  • Ziauddin Barani was the court poet of Firuz Shah Tughlaq.
  • Compositions of Ziauddin Baran: Tarikh-i-firozshahi, fatwa-i-jahandari.
  • Tarikh-i-Firoz Shahi is a work on medieval India, which covers the period from the reign of Ghiyas-ud-din Balban to the first six years of the reign of Firoz Shah Tughluq.
  • The Fatwa-i-Jahandari promoted a hierarchy among Muslim communities in the Indian subcontinent.
Amir Khusrau:
  • He was the first Muslim poet and played an important role in the invention of 'Khari Boli'.
  • He saw the rule of 7 sultans (Balban, Muhammad, Kaiqubad, Jalaluddin Khilji, Alauddin Khilji, Mubarak Shah Khilji, Ghiyasuddin Tughlaq).​​

Question: Identify the correct statement.
OP1: Resistance of a wire depends on the length and density of the wire.
OP2: Specific resistance is the same for all conductors.
OP3: Resistance of a wire depends on the length and cross-section of the wire.
OP4: Specific resistance is dependent on the cross-sectional area of the wire.
Solution:
The correct answer is Resistance of a wire depends on the length and cross-section of the wire.
Key Points
Concept:
Electric current is the flow of electric charges through a particular area of a conductor( a metallic wire) in unit time.
Electric current is mathematically expressed as:
  • I=Q/t,
I= current, Q= net charge flowing across any cross-section of the conductor, and t= time
  • For electric current to flow through a conductor, there should be a potential difference between two points in the conductor.
  • The electric potential difference is the work done to move a unit charge from one point to another in an electric circuit. V=W/Q, where, V is the potential difference, W is work done, and Q is the amount of charge flowing through the conductor. The S.I. unit of electric potential difference is volt(V).
  • According to Ohm's law, the electric potential difference across the ends of a wire in a given electric circuit is directly proportional to the current flowing through it.
  • V=IR, as V is the potential difference, I is current, R is Resistance
Resistance:
It is the ability of a conductor to resist the flow of charges through it when part of an electric circuit. The S.I unit of resistance is the ohm(Ω ).
The resistance of a conductor depends upon the following factors.
  • On the length of the conductor
  • On the area of cross-section of the conductor
  • Nature of the material or resistivity.
Resistivity is the property of a material by virtue of which it resists the flow of charges through it. The S.I unit of resistivity is Ω m.
Explanation: The resistance of a conductor is calculated by the following equation
R= ρ× l/a
  • R= resistance,p= resistivity, l= length of material, a= area of cross-section.
From the above equation, it is understood that
  • the resistance of a wire is directly proportional to the length of the wire and inversely proportional to the area of the cross-section.
  • resistance can never be negative as length and area are positive quantities.
  • resistance of the wire will remain constant for a given wire as the length and area of cross-section and resistivity remain constant.
Additional Information
MaterialsResistivity (Ω m)
Conductors
Silver1.60 × 10-8
Copper1.62 × 10-8
Aluminium2.63 × 10-8
Alloys
Manganin (an alloy of copper, manganese and nickel))44 × 10-6
Nichrome (an alloy of nickel, chromium, manganese and iron)100 × 10-6
Insulators

Rubber1013- 1016

Question: In which year was the Estimates Committee constituted for the first time in India?
Solution:
The correct answer is 1950.
Key Points
  • Estimates Committee
    • The origin of this committee can be traced to the standing finance committee set up in 1921.
    • The first Estimates Committee in the post-independence era was constituted in 1950 on the recommendation of John Mathai, the then finance minister.
    • Originally, it had 25 members but in 1956 its membership was raised to 30.
    • All the thirty members are from Lok Sabha only.
    • The Rajya Sabha has no representation in this committee.
    • These members are elected by the Lok Sabha every year from amongst its own members, according to the principles of proportional representation by means of a single transferable vote.
    • Thus, all parties get due representation in it.
    • The term of office is one year.
    • A minister cannot be elected as a member of the committee.
    • The chairman of the committee is appointed by the Speaker from amongst its members and he is invariably from the ruling party.
  • ​Functions of the committee
    • To report what economies, improvements in organization, efficiency, and administrative reform consistent with the policy underlying the estimates, can be affected.
    • To suggest alternative policies in order to bring about efficiency and economy in administration. To examine whether the money is well laid out within the limits of the policy implied in the estimates.
    • To suggest the form in which the estimates are to be presented to Parliament.
Additional Information The effectiveness of the role of the committee is limited by the following:
  • It examines the budget estimates only after they have been voted by the Parliament, and not before that.
  • It cannot question the policy laid down by the Parliament.
  • Its recommendations are advisory and not binding on the ministries.
  • It examines every year only certain selected ministries and departments. Thus, by rotation, it would cover all of them over a number of years.
  • It lacks the expert assistance of the CAG which is available to the Public Accounts Committee.
  • Its work is in the nature of a postmortem.

Question:
Identify which of the following statements are correct.
1.Hindustan Copper Limited (HCL) was incorporated on 9 November 1967.
2.The Khetri Copper Complex (KCC) is located in Rajasthan.
3.The headquarters of Mineral Exploration Consultancy Ltd. is located in Jaipur.
Solution:
The correct answer is 1 and 2 only.
Key Point
  • Hindustan Copper Limited
    • HCL is a company established by the Government of India in 1967.
    • The headquarters of Hindustan Copper Limited (HCL) is located in Kolkata, West Bengal.
    • Its primary objective is to explore, develop, and exploit copper mines in the country.
    • HCL has become one of the largest vertically integrated copper producers in India.
  • The Khetri Copper Complex
    • Khetri Copper Complex is a copper mining and smelting complex located in the state of Rajasthan, India.
    • It is operated by Hindustan Copper Limited (HCL) and is one of the largest copper mines in India, producing copper concentrate, cathodes, and sulphuric acid.
    • It is a significant contributor to India's copper production and exports.
  • Mineral Exploration Consultancy Ltd
    • Mineral Exploration Consultancy Ltd. (MECL) is headquartered in Nagpur, Maharashtra.
    • It is a government-owned company established in 1972 to carry out mineral exploration and related activities in India and abroad.
    • MECL has regional offices in various parts of India and is involved in projects ranging from geological mapping to drilling and testing of mineral deposits.

Question: Which part of the Constitution of India consists of the idea of a Welfare State?
Solution:
The correct answer is Directive Principles of State Policy.
Key Points
Directive Principles of state policy are about establishing social and economic democracy in the state.
  • These are some basic principles or instructions or guidelines for the government while formulating laws/policies of the country and in executing them.
  • Directive Principles aim at the establishment of welfare states.
  • Indian Constitution Part IV tells about DPSP.
  • The concept of DPSP is taken from Irish Constitution
  • It is not justiciable in court.
  • Dr. B.R Ambedkar called it "the novel feature of Indian Constitution".
Additional Information
  • Fundamental rights are the basic human rights enshrined in the constitution of India in Part III
    • Fundamental rights are justiciable in court.
    • The idea of fundamental rights taken from the US constitution
  • The idea of Fundamental Duties is inspired by the Constitution of Russia.
    • These were incorporated in Part IV-A of the Constitution by the 42nd Constitutional Amendment Act, 1976 on the recommendations of the Swaran Singh Committee.
    • Originally 10 in number, one more duty was added through the 86th Constitutional Amendment Act, 2002. All the eleven duties are listed in Article 51-A of the Constitution (the sole Article in Part-IV-A).
    • However, like the Directive Principles, the duties are also non-justiciable in nature.
  • The Preamble was taken from the US constitution
    • Source of the authority of the constitution: It derives its authority from the people of India
    • Nature of Indian state: It declares India to be a sovereign, socialistic, secular democratic, and republican polity
    • Objectives of the constitution: It specifies justice, liberty, equality, and fraternity as the objectives
    • Date of adoption: Nov 26th, 1949.

Question: Which of the following is constituted under Article 280 of the Constitution of India?
Solution:
The correct answer is Finance Commission.
Key Points
  • The Finance Commission in India is constituted by the President under article 280 of the Constitution.
  • The first finance commission was constituted in 1951.
  • Finance Commission is a constitutional body for the purpose of allocation of certain revenue resources between the Union and the State Governments.
  • The finance commission is appointed every five years.
  • The President lays the reports of the Finance commission before both the Houses of the Parliament.
  • The finance commission recommends to the President relating to the distribution of the net taxes to be shared between the centre and the states.
  • The finance commission consists of a Chairman and four members.​
Additional Information
  • The 14th Finance Commission was headed by YV Reddy.
  • The 15th Finance Commission is headed by Nand Kishore Singh.
  • The Finance Commission of India was established in 1951.
  • The first chairman of the Finance Commission was KC Neogy.

Question:
In India, which of the following statements is true about the National Investment Fund?
Statements:
I. It was created in 2005.
II. 75% of its annual income was to be used for schemes promoting health, education and employment.
III. It was dissolved in 2018
Solution:
The correct answer is Only statements I and II.
Key Points
  • ​National Investment Fund
    • The National Investment Fund (NIF) is a fund set up by the Government of India to receive disinvestment proceeds from various public sector undertakings (PSUs).
    • The fund was established in 2005 and is managed by a designated Asset Management Company (AMC).
    • The primary objective of the National Investment Fund is to promote social welfare and economic development by investing in infrastructure development, social sector programs, and other priority sectors of the Indian economy.
    • The fund is divided into three parts:
    • National Investment Fund I: This part of the fund received disinvestment proceeds from public sector units until 2009.
    • The corpus of this fund is INR 11,107 crore, and it is managed by the designated AMC.
    • National Investment Fund II: This part of the fund received disinvestment proceeds from public sector units from 2009 to 2013.
    • The corpus of this fund is INR 9,314 crore, and it is also managed by the designated AMC.
    • National Investment Fund III: This part of the fund received disinvestment proceeds from public sector units from 2013 onwards.
    • The corpus of this fund is not fixed, and the fund will remain in operation until further notice from the government.
    • It is also managed by the designated AMC.
    • The fund can invest only in debt and equity instruments of eligible companies, which include public sector units, private sector companies, and other eligible entities.
    • The investments must be made in compliance with the provisions of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) regulations and other applicable laws.
    • In conclusion, the National Investment Fund is a dedicated fund set up by the Government of India to channelize disinvestment proceeds from public sector units into priority sectors of the Indian economy.
    • The fund is managed by a designated AMC and governed by a set of guidelines issued by the Ministry of Finance.

Question: Bhimbetka, a noted site of the Palaeolithic period, is located in which state of India ?
Solution:
The correct answer is Madhya Pradesh.
Key Points
  • Madhya Pradesh state is the site of Bhimbetka.
  • The Bhimbetka rock shelters are an archaeological site in central India.
    • that spans the prehistoric Paleolithic and Mesolithic periods, as well as the historic period.
  • It is located in the Raisen District in the Indian state of Madhya Pradesh about 45 kilometers south-east of Bhopal.
  • It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site that consists of seven hills and over 750 rock shelters distributed over 10 km.
  • The Bhimbetka site has the oldest-known rock art in India, as well as is one of the largest prehistoric complexes.
Additional Information
  • Bhimbetka is also known as Bhima's Lounge (Bhima was the second of the five Pandava princes in the Hindu epic Mahabharata).
  • The Rock Shelters of Bhimbetka, a recognized world heritage site by UNESCO, are in the foothills of the Vindhyan Mountains on the southern edge of the central Indian plateau in the State of Madhya Pradesh.
  • Most of the paintings here are in red and white with occasional dashes of yellow and green, with themes culled from events in everyday life, thousands of years ago.
  • The scenes depicted are mainly of dancing, playing music, hunting, horse and elephant riding, decorating bodies, and collecting honey.

Question: The Act that is also known as ‘Morley-Minto Reforms’ is:
Solution:
The correct answer is Indian Councils Act of 1909.
Key Points
Morley-Minto Reform was drafted in 1909.
  • It was also called as Indian council act 1909.
  • Lord Minto was the Viceroy and Morley was the Secretary of state for India during Morley-Minto Reform.
  • This act introduced communal representation for the Muslims.
  • Morley-Minto Reform introduced the principle of election.
  • S. P Sinha was appointed as the first Indian member of the governor general's executive council.
  • Under Morley-Minto reforms, the number of elected members in the Imperial Legislative Council and Provincial Legislative Council was increased.
  • In the Provincial Councils, the non-official majority was introduced but since some of these non-official were nominated and not selected, the overall non-elected majority remained.
Additional Information
Government of India Act of 1935
  • Residuary legislative powers were vested in the Viceroy under the Government of India Act of 1935.
  • The Federal Court of India was established in Delhi under the Government of India Act, 1935.
  • Provisions of Government of India Act 1935:
    • Provincial autonomy was granted.
    • Dyarchy was abolished in the provinces but was introduced at the center.
    • The federal scheme for the Government of India was prescribed.
    • Bicameralism at the center in the form of the council of states and federal assembly.
    • The federal court was set up in Delhi.
    • Burma was separated from India.
    • The Council of the secretary of state was abolished.
Government of India Act of 1919
  • The main feature of the Government of India Act of 1919 is Diarchy in the provinces.
  • Dyarchy was introduced, i.e., there were two classes of administrators – Executive councilors and ministers. The Governor was the executive head of the province. The subjects were divided into two lists – reserved and transferred. The governor was in charge of the reserved list along with his executive councilors.
  • The Government of India act, 1919 relaxed the central control over the provinces by demarcating and separating the central and provincial subjects. The central and provincial legislatures were authorized to make laws on their respective list of subjects.

Question: In which year did Albert Einstein predict a new state of matter, the Bose-Einstein condensate (BEC), based on a quantum formulation by the Indian physicist Satyendra Nath Bose?
Solution:
The correct answer is 1924.
Key Points
  • Bose-Einstein Condensate is called the Fifth state of matter.
  • It is formed when a gas of bosons having low densities is cooled to an absolute zero temperature.
  • At this temperature, the atoms stop moving.
  • They thus clump to each other acting like a single atom with the whole group having identical physical properties.
  • Plasma is a subset of gas which, unlike ordinary gases, is made up of atoms where some or all the electrons are stripped and positively charged protons roam freely.
  • Albert Einstein predicts it in the year 1924.
Additional Information
  • States of Matter: There are five states of matter.
    • Solid
    • Liquid
    • Gas
    • Plasma
    • Bose-Eienstein Condensate(BEC)

Question:
Which of the following options is correct regarding sexually transmitted disease (STD)?
Statement A: Sexually transmitted diseases (STDs) are infections transmitted from an infected person to an uninfected person through sexual contact.
Statement B: HIV, HPV and Hepatitis B virus is responsible for STD.
OP1: Both Statements A and B incorrect
OP3: Both Statements A and B correct
Solution:
The correct answer is Option 3.
Key Points
  • HIV (Human Immunodeficiency Virus) is a virus that attacks and weakens the immune system, making individuals vulnerable to opportunistic infections and cancers.
  • HIV is spread through the exchange of bodily fluids, such as blood, semen, vaginal secretions, and breast milk, during unprotected sexual contact, sharing of needles, and from mother-to-child during pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding.
  • There are two types of HIV: HIV-1 and HIV-2. HIV-1 is the most common type found globally and is more virulent than HIV-2.
  • If left untreated, HIV can progress to AIDS (Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome), which is a collection of symptoms and infections that occur due to a severely weakened immune system.
Additional Information
  • Antiretroviral therapy (ART) is the standard treatment for HIV infection.
  • ART involves taking a combination of medications that target different stages of the HIV life cycle to suppress viral replication and reduce the viral load in the blood.
  • ART can prolong the lives of people living with HIV and significantly reduce the risk of transmitting the virus to others. There is no cure for HIV, but with early diagnosis and proper treatment, individuals living with HIV can live long and healthy lives.
  • Sexually transmitted diseases (STDs) are infections that can be transmitted through sexual contact, including vaginal, anal, and oral sex. These infections can be caused by bacteria, viruses, or parasites.
  • Common STDs include:
    • Chlamydia: A bacterial infection that can affect both men and women.
    • Gonorrhea: Another bacterial infection that can affect the genital tract, rectum, and throat.
    • Human papillomavirus (HPV): A viral infection that can cause genital warts and is linked to certain types of cancer.
    • Herpes: A viral infection that can cause painful blisters around the genitals or mouth.
    • Syphilis: A bacterial infection that can have serious long-term consequences if left untreated.
    • HIV/AIDS: A viral infection that attacks the immune system and can be transmitted through sexual contact, sharing needles, and from mother to child during childbirth or breastfeeding.
    • Hepatitis B is a sexually transmitted disease, but it is spread in other ways, too. It is a viral infection affecting the liver. It is transmitted through contact with infected blood or body fluids.

Question: What do you call the type of drugs that mimic the natural messenger by switching on the receptor?
Solution:
The correct answer is Option 3.
Key Points
  • Agonists are a type of drug that bind to and activate a receptor in the body, producing a biological response that is similar to the response produced by the body's natural messenger for that receptor.
  • This is in contrast to antagonists, which bind to the receptor but do not activate it, blocking the effects of the natural messenger or other agonists.​
Additional Information
  • Antidepressants are medications that are primarily used to treat depression.
    • They work by altering the levels of certain chemicals in the brain, such as serotonin, norepinephrine, and dopamine, which are involved in regulating mood, emotions, and behavior.
    • There are several different types of antidepressants, including selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs), serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitors (SNRIs), tricyclic antidepressants (TCAs), and monoamine oxidase inhibitors (MAOIs). Each type of antidepressant works in a slightly different way and may have different side effects.
  • Depressants are a class of drugs that slow down or depress the central nervous system (CNS). They are also referred to as sedatives, tranquilizers, or downers. Depressants have various medical uses, such as treating anxiety, insomnia, and seizures. However, they can also be abused for their calming and euphoric effects.
    • Examples of depressants include:
      • Benzodiazepines: These are a group of drugs commonly prescribed for anxiety and insomnia. Examples include diazepam (Valium), alprazolam (Xanax), and lorazepam (Ativan).
      • Barbiturates: These are a type of sedative that were once commonly used for treating anxiety and insomnia but are now mostly used in anesthesia. Examples include phenobarbital and secobarbital.
      • Alcohol: This is a legal depressant that is widely consumed and can lead to impaired judgment, decreased coordination, and slowed reaction times.
      • Opioids: While opioids are primarily painkillers, they also have sedative effects on the CNS. Examples include oxycodone, morphine, and codeine.
      • Depressants are highly addictive, and their abuse can lead to physical and psychological dependence. Overdosing on depressants can be dangerous and potentially fatal, as they can cause respiratory depression, coma, and death.

Question: Identify a type of season that is NOT a part of the four seasons of India.
Solution:
The correct answer is The southeast monsoon season.
Key Points
Four main seasons can be identified in India.
  • Winter season.
  • Summer season.
  • Southwest monsoon.
  • Retreating monsoon.
The southeast monsoon season is not part of the four seasons of India.​
Additional Information
Winter season characteristics:
  • Winter season is between Mid-November to February.
  • Mean daily temperature below 21o C in North India.
  • Some parts experience temperatures below the freezing point.
  • Temperature increases from north to south.
Summer season characteristics:
  • The summer season in India can be experienced in April, May, and June.
  • The temperature rises up to 45oC in north India.
  • Summer season is a completely dry season.
  • Summer in south India is not so extreme.
Southwest monsoon characteristics:
  • Southwest monsoon in India can be experienced in June-September.
  • The whole of India is under the southwest monsoon.
  • India faces severe cyclones and thunderstorms.
  • June is the hottest month.
  • The temperature remains low during July and August which rises high in September with a decreasing amount of precipitation.
Retreating monsoon:
  • Retreating monsoons in India can be experienced in October-November.
  • Monsoon winds are retreating gradually and the sudden rise of temperature with October heat.
  • Day temperature is high and nights are cool and pleasant.
  • The average minimum temperature falls below 20o C.

Question:
Which of the following statements are correct regarding the benefits of the retired President of India?
A. The former President of India will also be entitled to a monthly pension of ₹2.5 lakh.
B. He/She is entitled to a secretarial staff comprising a private secretary, a personal assistant, an additional private secretary, two peons, and office expenses up to ₹1 lakh per annum.
C. He/She is also entitled to free highest-class travel anywhere in India, accompanied by one person, by rail, air, or steamer.
Solution:
The correct answer is Option 4.
Key Points
  • According to the Act, a retired President of India is entitled to a fully furnished residence, free medical attendance and treatment, a monthly pension of Rs. 2.5 lakhs, and secretarial staff consisting of a private secretary, a personal assistant, an additional private secretary, two peons, and office expenses up to Rs. 1 lakh per annum.
  • In addition, a retired President of India is entitled to free highest-class travel anywhere in India, accompanied by one person, by rail, air, or steamer. The spouse of a retired President is also entitled to a family pension at the rate of 50 percent of what a retired President gets, for the rest of his/her life, in case the President dies in office, resigns, or demits office after the end of the term. The spouse is also entitled to medical attendance and treatment free of charge, as well as a furnished residence, a car or car allowance, and free top-class travel within the country.
  • It is worth noting that these entitlements are provided to ensure that the former President and their spouse can continue to lead a dignified life after retirement, and are not meant to be a form of personal gain or enrichment.
Additional Information
  • Droupadi Murmu took office as the 15th president of India, becoming the second woman and the first tribal person to hold the office.

Question: Which option correctly represents the countries in decreasing order of HDI, as released in September 2022?

Key Points

  • The HDI was created to emphasize that people and their capabilities should be the ultimate criteria for assessing the development of a country, not economic growth alone.
  • As a part of the Human Development Index, every year United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) releases the Human Development Report (HDR).

Question:
Identify which of the following statements about agriculture in India are correct.
1. Rabi crops are sown in India from October to December and harvested from April to June.
2. Important crops grown during Rabi in India are paddy, maize, gram, soybean and mustard.
3. Aus, Aman and Boro are three crops of paddy in Assam, West Bengal and Odisha.
Solution:
The correct answer is 1 and 3 only.
Key Points
  • The word Rabi is derived from the Arabic language and means “Spring”.
  • Rabi crops are sown in winter (hence called winter season crops) from October to December and harvested in summer from April to June.​
Hence statement 1 is correct.
  • statement 2 is incorrect. While gram (chickpeas) and mustard are indeed important Rabi season crops, paddy (rice) and soybean are primarily Kharif crops, sown in the monsoon season (June to July) and harvested in the autumn (September to October).
  • Maize is grown in both seasons but is more commonly associated with the Kharif season.
  • The typical Rabi crops include wheat, barley, peas, lentils, and some types of mustard.
Hence statement 2 is incorrect.
  • Though these crops are grown in large parts of India, states from the north and north-western parts such as Punjab, Haryana, Himachal Pradesh, Jammu and Kashmir, Uttarakhand, and Uttar Pradesh are important for the production of wheat and other rabi crops.
  • The availability of precipitation during the winter months due to the western temperate cyclones helps in the success of these crops.
  • In states like Assam, West Bengal and Odisha, three crops of paddy are grown in a year.
  • These are Aus, Aman and Boro.
    • Aus refers July- August season.
    • Aman refers to the December- January seasons.
    • Boro refers march- May seasons, these are the varieties of rice.
Hence statement 3 is correct.

Question: Deficiency of which of the following vitamins causes excessive bleeding from wounds?
Solution:
The correct answer is Vitamin K.
Key Points
Vitamin K
  • Vitamin K is called antihemorrhagic.
  • It is found in the green leaves of plants, as well as in those parts of plants that contain chlorophyll, a lot of it in berries of mountain ash, as well as in the liver.
  • Vitamin K is needed for the posttranslational modification of proteins required for blood coagulation.
  • Vitamin K is involved in metabolism pathways, bone mineralization, cell growth, and metabolism of the blood vessel wall.
Vitamin K injection:
  • It is used to treat bleeding (hemorrhage or threatened hemorrhage) associated with a low blood level of prothrombin or factor VII.
  • It is recommended that vitamin K be given IV, and not IM until coagulation parameters normalize to minimize the risk of hematoma at the injection site.
  • 1 mg IM/subcutaneous is the FDA-approved dosage.
  • Neonate has low plasma concentrations and low levels of vitamin K-dependent clotting factors.
  • Therefore, immediately after the birth, Vitamin K will be administered to the newborn in order to prevent bleeding.
Additional Information
Vitamins :
  • Vitamins are organic substances that are required for the proper functioning of the body.
  • Vitamins are divided into two groups:
  • Fat-soluble (Vit. A, D, E, and K)
  • Water-soluble ( Vitamins of B group and Vit. C).

Question:
Which of the following statements is/are correct regarding changes to Atal Pension Yojana Scheme (APY) done in 2022?
A. According to the new criteria, any citizen who is or has been an income-tax payer, shall not be eligible to join APY after 1 October 2022.
B. Subscribers would receive the guaranteed minimum monthly pension of ₹1,000 or ₹2,000 or ₹3,000 or ₹4,000 or ₹5,000 at the age of 80 years.
C. As per the new rules, subscribers can make contributions to APY on a monthly basis only.
Solution:
The correct answer is A only.
Key Points
  • According to the new criteria, any citizen who is or has been an income-tax payer, shall not be eligible to join APY after 1 October 2022.
  • Income-tax payers will not be allowed to enrol in the government's pension security scheme Atal Pension Yojana (APY) from October 1.
  • Income-tax payers enrolled before October 1 will continue in the scheme.
Hence statement 1 is correct.Important Points
  • Atal Pension Yojana
    • The scheme was launched on 9th May 2015, with the objective of creating a universal social security system for all Indians, especially the poor, the underprivileged and the workers in the unorganised sector.
    • Administered By: Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority through National Pension System (NPS).
    • Eligibility: Any citizen of India can join the APY scheme.
    • The age of the subscriber should be between 18-40 years.
  • Benefits:
    • It provides a minimum guaranteed pension ranging from Rs 1000 to Rs 5000 on attaining 60 years of age.
Hence, statement 2 is not correct.
  • The amount of pension is guaranteed for a lifetime to the spouse on the death of the subscriber.

  • Out of the total APY subscribers, 44 per cent are female subscribers while 56 per cent are male subscribers.
  • Further, out of the total APY subscribers, 45 per cent are aged between 18 and 25 years.

Question: Which of the following is considered a capital expense?
Solution:
The correct answer is Construction of school buildings.
Key Points
  • The construction of school buildings is considered a capital expense because it involves the creation or acquisition of a long-term asset that will provide economic benefits to the organization over multiple years.
  • School buildings are expensive to construct and require a significant investment of resources, such as money, time, and materials.
  • As a result, they are classified as capital expenditures, which are distinguished from operating expenses that are necessary for the day-to-day operations of a business or organization.
Additional Information
  • Capital Expense:
    • Capital expenses are the expenses incurred by a company to acquire or upgrade fixed, tangible or intangible assets, such as property, plant, and equipment (PP&E), patents, or trademarks.
    • Capital expenses are typically large in amount and are expected to provide benefits for several years or more.
    • These expenses are capitalized on the balance sheet and then depreciated or amortized over their useful lives.
  • Revenue expense: Expenses incurred in the normal course of business operations, such as salaries, rent, and utilities, that are immediately charged to expenses on the income statement.
  • Administrative expense: Expenses incurred in the general administration of a business, such as an office rent, salaries of administrative staff, and office supplies.
  • Operating expense: Expenses incurred in the day-to-day operation of a business, such as rent, salaries, and advertising.

Question: A light bulb working on a 18 V battery draws a current of 3 A. What will be the resistance of the bulb?
Solution:
The correct answer is 6 Ω.
Key Points
We can use Ohm's law to calculate the resistance of the bulb:
Ohm's law states that the current (I) through a conductor between two points is directly proportional to the voltage (V) across the two points, and inversely proportional to the resistance (R) between them:
I = V / R
R = V / I
Where:
R = resistance in ohms (Ω)
V = voltage in volts (V)
I = current in amperes (A)
Given that the voltage (V) is 18 V and the current (I) is 3 A, we can substitute these values into the equation to find the resistance (R):
R = V / I
⇒ 18 V / 3 A = 6 Ω
Therefore, the resistance of the bulb is 6 ohms (Ω).

Trojan malware example to show how it works.

Question: ______ is also known as electronic disk.
Solution:
Option 3) Solid-State Drive is also known as electronic disk.
  • Solid State Drive (SSD) is a type of mass storage device similar to a hard disk drive (HDD).
  • It supports reading and writing data and maintains stored data in a permanent state even without power.
  • Internal SSDs connect to a computer like a hard drive, using standard IDE or SATA connections.
  • While SSDs serve the same function as hard drives, their internal components are much different.
  • Unlike hard drives, SSDs do not have any moving parts (which is why they are called solid-state drives). Instead of storing data on magnetic platters, SSDs store data using flash memory.

Question: ________ a high-speed device used in CPU that is utilised to store data temporarily during processing.
Solution:
Registers:
  • Registers are a type of computer memory used to quickly accept, store, and transfer data and instructions that are being used immediately by the CPU.
  • The registers used by the CPU are often termed Processor registers.
  • A processor register may hold an instruction, a storage address, or any data.
  • The computer needs processor registers for manipulating data and a register for holding a memory address.

Question: Which of the following option of print settings is used to choose only specific pages in MS-Word 365?
Solution:
The correct option for choosing only specific pages in MS-Word 365 is "Print Custom".
"Print Current Page" will print only the page that is currently selected.
Additional Information
  • "Print All Pages" is an option that will print every page in the document.
  • "Print Selection" will print only the selected text or object in the document.
  • "Print Custom" allows you to specify a range of pages to be printed. For example, if you only want to print pages 3-5 of a document, you can enter "3-5" in the Custom Range field.
  • To access these print options in MS-Word 365, you can click on the "File" menu and then select "Print".
  • In the print settings window, you will see a "Settings" section where you can choose the type of print job you want to perform.
  • Select "Print Custom Range" and enter the page numbers you want to print in the "Pages" field.
  • You can enter a single page number, a range of pages separated by a hyphen, or a combination of both.
  • Once you have entered the desired pages, click "Print" to start the print job.

Question: _______ displays a list of utility configure the computer system and install software and hardware.
Solution:
The correct option is "Control Panel".
  • Control Panel is a built-in feature in the Windows operating system that provides a centralized location to configure and manage various settings for the computer system, as well as to install software and hardware.
  • It contains a variety of applets or utilities, each of which provides access to specific settings or tasks.
  • Examples of applets in the Control Panel include "Programs and Features", which allows you to install and uninstall programs, "Device Manager", which allows you to manage hardware devices installed on the computer, "Display Settings", which allows you to adjust the display resolution and other settings, and "User Accounts", which allows you to manage user accounts on the computer.
Additional Information
  • Help and Support is a feature that provides access to help documentation and support resources for Windows and other software applications. It contains a variety of articles, tutorials, and troubleshooting guides to help users resolve common issues and learn how to use different features of the operating system and applications.
  • Taskbar is a bar that appears at the bottom of the Windows desktop, displaying a list of open programs and providing quick access to various system settings and features, such as the Start menu, notifications, and system tray.
  • Run is a feature that allows you to quickly open and run programs, files, and system commands by typing in their names or file paths in the "Run" dialog box. It is accessed by pressing the "Windows key + R" keyboard shortcut.

Question: Which of the following is correct option in MS-Excel 365, if a value in a cell of column A and row 10 is to be referred in a function or formula?
Solution:
The correct option in MS-Excel 365, if a value in a cell of column A and row 10 is to be referred in a function or formula, is option 3) A10.
  • In Excel, cell references are used in formulas to refer to specific cells or ranges of cells.
  • A cell reference consists of the column letter and row number of the cell.
  • In this case, the value in cell A10 can be referred to in a formula or function by using the cell reference A10.
  • Suppose you have an Excel spreadsheet with data in various cells, and you want to refer to the value in cell A10 using a function or formula.
  • For example, let's assume that cell A10 contains the value 50.
  • In this case, if you want to use the value in cell A10 in a formula, you would use the reference A10.
  • Here's a simple example using the SUM function to add the value in cell A10 to the value in cell B5: =SUM(A10, B5)
  • In the above formula, we are instructing Excel to sum the value in cell A10 (which is 50) with the value in cell B5. The reference A10 tells Excel to use the value from that specific cell.
  • So, by using the reference A10 in your formulas or functions, you can effectively refer to the value in the cell and incorporate it into your calculations or logical operations within MS Excel 365.
Additional Information
  • Option 1) A-10 is not a valid cell reference as the hyphen (-) is not used to indicate the cell location in Excel.
  • Option 2) 10A is also an invalid cell reference as the row number should always come after the column letter.
  • Option 4) A : 10 is a range reference, not a cell reference, which would refer to all cells in columns A through 10, which is not what is needed in this case.

Question: While ______ data transfers from the customers’ machine to the server.
Solution:
The correct option is "uploading".
  • Uploading is the process of transferring data or files from the customer's machine to the server.
  • This is typically done when the customer wants to share files, photos, videos or other types of data with other users on the internet or store data in the cloud.
Additional Information
  • Browsing refers to the act of searching or exploring the internet by opening web pages and following links.
  • Browsing does not involve transferring data from the customer's machine to the server.
  • Forwarding refers to the process of sending an email or message from one person to another.
  • This also does not involve transferring data from the customer's machine to the server.
  • Downloading is the process of transferring data or files from the server to the customer's machine.
  • This is typically done when the customer wants to access files, photos, videos or other types of data from the internet or cloud storage.
  • In summary, while uploading data transfers from the customer's machine to the server, and while downloading data transfers from the server to the customer's machine.

Question: Which among the following is incorrect about Laser Printers?
OP1: Uses laser lights for producing dots to form characters on a page
OP2: Cannot print multiple copies at a time
Solution:
Option 2) Cannot print multiple copies at a time is incorrect about Laser Printers.
  • Laser printers can print multiple copies at a time by either using manual duplex printing or automatic duplex printing.
  • In manual duplex printing, the user has to manually flip the paper to print on both sides, while in automatic duplex printing, the printer itself prints on both sides without the user's intervention
Additional Information
  • Uses laser lights for producing dots to form characters on a page: This is true. Laser printers use a laser beam to create an electrostatic image, or "latent image," on a rotating metal drum called a "photoreceptor." The laser beam is directed onto the drum by a series of mirrors and lenses, and it causes the drum's surface to become electrically charged in certain areas. Then, the drum is coated with toner (a fine powder) that sticks to the charged areas, forming the image. Finally, the toner is transferred to the paper and fused onto it using heat.
  • Fast speed: This is true. Laser printers are known for their fast printing speed, especially when compared to inkjet printers. They can print up to 25-50 pages per minute (ppm) depending on the model and complexity of the document.
  • Supports multiple fonts and sizes: This is true. Laser printers support multiple fonts and sizes, which is one of their advantages over older printing technologies such as dot matrix printers.
  • The printer driver software installed on the computer sends the fonts and sizes information to the printer, and the printer uses it to produce the printed output

Question: Shading option in MS-Word 365 is used for ______.
OP1: changing the color around the selected text
OP2: changing the color behind the selected text
OP3: changing the color of the selected text
OP4: making the text pop by highlighting it
Solution:
The correct option is 2) changing the color behind the selected text.
  • Shading in MS-Word 365 is used to change the color behind the selected text.
  • This is a formatting option that allows you to highlight or emphasize specific text by shading the background with a different color or pattern.
Additional Information
  • Changing the color around the selected text refers to changing the color of the border or background of a text box or shape that surrounds the selected text. This option is different from shading, which specifically refers to changing the color behind the selected text.
  • Changing the color of the selected text refers to changing the font color of the text itself. This option is different from shading, which specifically refers to changing the color behind the text.
  • Making the text pop by highlighting it can be achieved by using shading, which adds a background color or pattern to the selected text to make it stand out from the surrounding text.
  • In summary, the shading option in MS-Word 365 is used to change the color behind the selected text.

Question: Which among the following statements is incorrect?
OP1: Trojan looks like a legitimate software.
OP2: Some Trojans create backdoors to give malicious users access to the system.
OP3: Trojan self-replicate and infects other files.
OP4: Trojan spreads through user interaction such as opening an email attachment or downloading and executing a file from the Internet.
Solution:
The incorrect statement is 3) Trojan self-replicate and infects other files.
Explanation:
  • This statement 3 is incorrect. Unlike viruses, Trojans do not have the ability to self-replicate and infect other files. Instead, Trojans rely on social engineering techniques to trick users into running them, such as disguising themselves as legitimate software or using enticing file names to make users open them.
Additional Information
  • This statement 1 is correct. A Trojan is a type of malware that looks like a legitimate software, but actually performs malicious actions on the victim's computer.
    This statement 2 is also correct. Some Trojans create backdoors on the victim's computer, which allow malicious users to gain unauthorized access to the system and carry out malicious activities.
  • This statement 4 is correct. Trojans typically spread through user interaction, such as opening an email attachment or downloading and executing a file from the Internet.
  • Once a Trojan is executed on the victim's computer, it can carry out various malicious actions such as stealing sensitive information, deleting files, or creating backdoors for other malware to enter the system.
  • In summary, the incorrect statement is 3) Trojan self-replicate and infects other files.

Question: The memory unit that communicates directly with the CPU is called _______ memory.
Solution:
The correct answer is cache
Key Points
  • The cache memory is a high-speed memory type that resides between the CPU and the main memory (RAM).
  • It's used to temporarily store data that's frequently accessed by the CPU.
  • Since cache memory is faster than RAM, it helps to reduce the time it takes for the CPU to get data and instructions.
  • When the CPU needs to read or write to a location in main memory, it first checks whether a copy of that data is in the cache. If so, the CPU immediately reads from or writes to the cache, which is much faster than reading from or writing to main memory.
  • So, in the context of your question, cache memory is the memory unit that communicates directly with the CPU.
  • While main memory (RAM) does also communicate with the CPU, it doesn't do so as directly or quickly as cache memory.
  • Backup and auxiliary memory, on the other hand, refer to additional or secondary storage that is not directly accessed by the CPU, such as external hard drives, tapes, or cloud storage.
Additional Information
  • Cache memory, is a high-speed memory unit that stores frequently accessed data and instructions to reduce the access time to main memory.
  • Backup memory is used to create copies of data or to store data for safekeeping in case of a system failure or other issues.
  • Auxiliary memory refers to secondary storage devices, such as hard disk drives, solid-state drives, or flash drives, which are used to store data for long-term use.
NOTE:-
Option 3, "main" memory, refers to the primary storage or system memory in a computer, typically RAM (Random Access Memory). While it is true that the CPU can and does communicate directly with main memory, it's not the most immediate form of memory to the CPU.
The reason option 1, "cache" memory, is more accurate is because cache is a smaller, faster memory that stores copies of the most frequently used data from main memory. It is located closer to the CPU and offers quicker access time, allowing the CPU to process data more efficiently.
So, while the CPU communicates with both types of memory, cache memory is designed to be the immediate, go-between memory that the CPU uses before accessing the slightly slower main memory.

Question: The instruction that is not to be executed immediately is placed in the ______.
Solution:
The correct answer is 4) Instruction Buffer Register (IBR).
  • When a program is loaded into memory, the CPU retrieves the instructions from memory and stores them in a small buffer called the Instruction Buffer Register (IBR).
  • The IBR holds the current instruction waiting to be executed by the CPU.
  • The CPU executes the instruction in the IBR and then fetches the next instruction from memory into the IBR.
Additional Information
  • The Current Instruction Register (CIR) (option 1) holds the instruction that is currently being executed by the CPU.
  • The Memory Address Register (MAR) (option 2) holds the memory address of the next instruction or data item to be fetched from or stored into memory.
  • The Program Counter (PC) (option 3) holds the memory address of the next instruction to be executed by the CPU.

Question: Video Graphics Array connectors are those which connect the monitor to a computer's video card and has ______ holes.
Solution:
The correct answer is 4) 15.
  • Video Graphics Array (VGA) connectors are used to connect a computer's video card to a monitor or display.
  • A VGA connector has 15 pins or holes arranged in three rows of five.
  • The VGA connector is an analog connection, which means it transmits a continuous signal that is susceptible to interference and degradation over long distances.
  • VGA connectors were first introduced in the late 1980s and were the standard for computer displays for many years.
  • However, with the rise of digital displays, such as DVI and HDMI, VGA is becoming less common.
  • Many modern computers and displays still include VGA ports, but they are often supplemented by digital connections.
  • In summary, the correct option is 4) 15, which refers to the number of pins or holes in a VGA connector.

Question: __________is a passage to connect two networks that may work on different networking models.
Solution:
The correct option is 3) Gateway.
Gateway
  • A gateway is a passage used to connect two networks that may work on different networking models.
  • It is a device that provides interconnectivity between networks with different network protocols.
  • For example, a gateway can be used to connect a local area network (LAN) to the internet.
  • It acts as an intermediary between the LAN and the internet, translating network protocols as necessary.
  • Gateways can also provide other services such as filtering, translation, and routing of data.
  • They are commonly used in enterprise networks to connect different departments and locations.
Additional Information
Switch
  • Switch: A switch is a networking device that connects multiple devices on a local area network (LAN).
  • It uses the MAC address of each device to direct network traffic only to its intended recipient, which makes network communication more efficient.
Hub
  • Hub: A hub is a networking device that connects multiple devices on a LAN.
  • It receives network traffic from one device and sends it to all other devices on the network, which can lead to network congestion and reduced network performance.
Router
  • A router is a networking device that connects multiple networks and routes network traffic between them.
  • It operates at the network layer of the OSI model and can connect networks that use different networking technologies.
  • For example, a router can connect a local area network (LAN) to the internet, enabling devices on the LAN to access resources on the internet.
  • The router can also be used to direct traffic between different LANs within an organization or between different branches of an organization.
  • Routers are also capable of providing security features such as firewall protection and virtual private network (VPN) connectivity.
  • They can be used to prioritize traffic to ensure that critical applications receive the necessary bandwidth, and they can also be used to block traffic from specific sources.

Question: _______ cookies track you and expose your privacy.
Solution:
The correct option is 2) Third-party cookies.
Explanation:
  • Cookies are small text files that websites store on a user's computer or device when they visit the site.
  • Cookies can be used for a variety of purposes, such as remembering a user's preferences or login information.
  • However, some cookies can also be used to track a user's activity across multiple websites, which can raise privacy concerns.
Third-party
  • Third-party cookies are cookies that are set by a domain other than the one the user is visiting.
  • For example, if a user visits a website and that website has embedded content from a third-party domain,
  • such as an advertisement or a social media plugin, the third-party domain may set a cookie on the user's computer.
  • This can allow the third-party domain to track the user's activity across multiple websites.
Additional Information
Persistent
  • Persistent cookies are cookies that remain on a user's computer or device even after they close their browser.
  • These cookies can be used to remember a user's preferences or login information the next time they visit the website.
Session
  • Session cookies are cookies that are deleted when a user closes their browser.
  • These cookies are often used to keep track of a user's activity during a single browsing session, such as adding items to a shopping cart.
Zombie
  • Zombie cookies, also known as "evercookies," are a type of persistent cookie that are difficult to remove.
  • Zombie cookies can be used to track a user's activity even if they delete their cookies or use private browsing mode.
